intro: Scorzonera communis, commonly known as common scorzonera, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring basal leaves that are broad and hairy, and yellow flowers with five petals. The plant produces a long, tuberous root that is often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed areas. Scorzonera communis is also valued as a food plant for certain Lepidoptera species.
